candidates.name: Mike ter Maat
candidates.title: Cop with a Ph.D. in Economics
candidates.info: Wants to allow states to secede, end all taxes, end social security, end the federal reserve, end public education, end investment in colleges, and withdraw from NATO. He wants to require that all military actions to be approved by the states, which will magically somehow not take years every time.

candidates.name: Joe 'Exotic' Maldonado
candidates.title: Convicted felon
candidates.info: Yes, the Tiger King, who was convicted in 2019 of hiring hitmen to murder Carole Baskin, killing tigers, trafficking tigers, and falsifying records. Wants to abolish the IRS with no replacement, believes all politicians are corrupt (especially the ones who believe in treating animals humanely), wants to charge illegal immigrants $50 a month to exist, and wants other NATO countries to pay us in oil for our protection.

candidates.name: Jacob Hornberger
candidates.title: Founder of a political NGO
candidates.info: A lawyer and author, Jacob wants to abolish ICE and make an easier path to citizenship, ending anti-immigration policies and opening free international trade. He supports LGBTQ+ rights, and would end the war on drugs and the war on terrorism. He also wants to end social security and medicare, and force retired seniors back to work. Wants to ignore his degree in economics and reinstate the gold standard, abolish the IRS, the FBI and the EPA. Would immediately withdraw from NATO and other alliances, and return to pre-WW2 isolationism.

candidates.name: Justin Amash
candidates.title: Former US Representative from Michigan
candidates.info: Polled well when running in 2020 and indicated interest in running for president during a 2022 interview. Strongly pro-same-sex marriage, believing the government shouldn't be involved in consensual relationships at all. Believes that trans rights is a non-issue because the law shouldn't discriminate between sex or genders. However, Justin also opposes women's rights, believes abortion should be punishable with prison time, was one of only four representatives to vote against recognizing lynching as a hate crime, and the only member of congress to vote against creating a national suicide prevention hotline.

candidates.name: Dave Smith
candidates.title: Comedian
candidates.info: Has a podcast about how the government is bad and we should all feel bad. Major member of the Mises Caucus (the alt-right ultra-conservative group which has taken over the Libertarian Party).

candidates.name: Tulsi Gabbard
candidates.title: Former US Representative from Hawaii
candidates.info: Ran for the Democratic nomination in 2020. Has recently gone off the rails, unironically opposing all libertarian ideals, such as women's rights and free speech. Wants end immigration and ban the concept of sexuality from schools. Supports border walls and Russia's invasion of Ukraine. She now focuses her time on fighting the gravest of national threats: the concept of 'woke'.

candidates.name: Joshua Rodriguez
candidates.title: Quantum computing chemical engineer
candidates.info: Qualifications include (self-reported): having been born, having lost his father as a child

candidates.name: Joshua Smith
candidates.title: Vice Chair of the Libertarian National Committee
candidates.info: Wants to end the federal government's ability to regulate its own currency. Wants to prosecute public health officials for crimes against humanity for their role in the "tyranny" of the pandemic. Wants to end public education with no replacement, believing students need only learn the free market to be successful in modern society. Believes trans rights is a mental health crisis. Believes Jews are hateful and extreme and their evil organizations must be outlawed.

candidates.name: Lars Mapstead
candidates.title: Grew up very poor
candidates.info: According to his self-written bio, Lars grew up without electricity or running water, and now believes that the best way for Libertarians to have an influence on elections is for there to be more of them, thus providing more votes for Libertarian candidates. Believes that political polarization is a plot by the government to distract us from taxes.

candidates.name: Jo Jorgensen
candidates.title: Libertarian presidential nominee in 2020
candidates.info: Won the 2020 Libertarian presidential nomination, the first woman to do so, and went on to lose the general election by a mere 72 million votes. Wants to replace social security with an improved retirement account welfare system. Wants to end the war on drugs and pardon all non-violent drug offenders. Wants to demilitarize the police and reinstate a policy of armed neutrality (i.e. stop invading other countries). Would tear down Trump's border wall and make the path to citizenship easier. Criticized Trump's Covid-era corporate bailouts as anti-democratic.

candidates.name: Chase Oliver
candidates.title: Self-proclaimed most-influential libertarian ever
candidates.info: Pro-choice, but also anti-vaccine. Wants to end public education and ensure that everyone can freely buy guns without any of those damn guberment restrictions, checks or red-flag laws. If elected, Chase promises to magically end inflation.

candidates.name: Keenan Wallace Dunham
candidates.title: Guy from Myrtle Beach
candidates.info: Proposed policies include legalizing gambling, creating a government social-security-number-based Bitcoin platform, and colonizing Antarctica. Keenan's campaign website is a 13,208-word rant about the government.

candidates.name: Vermin Supreme
candidates.title: Performance artist and political satirist
candidates.info: Has decided to run as an independent in an effort to distance himself from the increasingly insane Libertarian Party, saying he regrets ever getting involved with them, saying quote 'It has become a terrible dumpsterfire of a shitshow. I regret my involvement in such a non-functional embarrassment full of paleo dipshits, pedo apologists, and culture war fuckwads'. Came in third place in the 2020 Libertarian nomination. Promises a free pony to every citizen if elected. Believes in zombie apocalypse awareness and time travel research. Will make brushing teeth required by law.

candidates.name: Tevin Handford
candidates.title: College student majoring in creative writing
candidates.info: Official biography is as follows, quote: 'Inventor- Loyal Company Product Immune Booster/ Bill or Lawmaker- Treaty Of Peace, Sex Consent Law, Criminal Charge, and Elder Abuse- Financial Exploitation- Neglect an Omission Abuse- Domestic Violence an Willful; Immune booster that can be taken in liquid, pill or needle injection (Universally produced) Product is sold in Clinics, Hospitals, Pharmacies, Military Doctors, and Mental Health Institutions. For Viruses an Diseases Universal.'

candidates.name: Beau Lindsey
candidates.title: Reddit user trying to start a literal crusade
candidates.info: Actively believes in 'retaking the holy land' through a new crusade—which he will lead—to remove the evil Jews from the rightful home of 'warriors in Christ' like Beau. Claims the Libertarian Party is corrupt because it supports women's rights. Spends his time spamming every political subreddit he can find with self-propaganda. Believes in the separation of church and state, except when the state takes any action contrary to the wishes of the church.

candidates.name: Robert Milnes
candidates.title: Conspiracy theory blogger
candidates.info: Believes that earthworms and slugs are the only positive forms of life, and that this shows that schools should be run more like prisons with a single guarded entrance. Believes he is immune to cancer, and that being more like earthworms and slugs cures depression. Believes that, and this is a direct quote, 'all living organisms are composed of exactly 50% biological and 50% sexual energy'. Believes the train crash in Ohio in 2023 was an instance of Jewish terrorism, just like 9/11 and the withdrawal of US troops in Afghanistan.

candidates.name: Angela Walls-Windhauser
candidates.info: Most recent experience was as chair of a religious nonprofit which went into bankruptcy 15 years ago.

candidates.name: Michael Rectenwald
candidates.title: Anti-woke author
candidates.info: Has written several books about how he's being oppressed by woke snowflakes and how it hurts his delicate feelings. His presidential website is just lorem ipsum, so we can't know too much about his platform.

candidates.name: Hugo Valdez-Garcia
candidates.title: Pro-cars and anti-homework
candidates.info: Would make homework illegal in schools and force colleges to remove all general education requirements. Would abolish federal prisons. Wishes to require immigrants to understand English, despite Hugo's own website being written in broken English. Would abolish all traffic speed limits and make it illegal for children to be in the road. Would revise jury trials to have the public call in their votes, thus deciding criminal cases by popular opinion regardless of facts or evidence. Wishes to add two days to the week, believing this would give everyone extra time to rest, as well as decoupling months from the seasons which would help everyone relax.

candidates.name: Robert Sansone
candidates.title: Aerospace consultant
candidates.info: Wants to reform the healthcare system, without providing any details for what this means (the policy link on his website is a fake link). Robert follows suit with the rest of his platform, making broad vague statements lacking in any detail whatsoever.

candidates.name: David 'Time Traveler' Dunlap
candidates.title: Twitch streamer
candidates.info: Primarily concerned with restructuring the Libertarian Party in order to make a bid for major party status in the future. Is calling for ranked-choice voting, a redevelopment and clarification of the core party platform, and a refocus of the party toward local elections.
